block.p: BROWN SHOE CO., St. Louis, operator of the Famous Footwear and Naturalizer shoe-retailing chains, said it bought the closely held Mil-Mar Shoe Co., Milwaukee, to add 26 shoe stores in Wisconsin, Illinois and Iowa. Terms were not disclosed.

ARCH CHEMICALS INC., Norwalk, Conn., a specialty chemical company spun off by the Olin Corporation in 1999, said it would buy Brooks Industries, South Plainfield, N.J., a maker of personal-care products, for $37 million to add a line of hair and skin products.

ETHAN ALLEN INTERIORS INC., Danbury, Conn., a manufacturer and retailer of furniture, agreed to buy a production plant in Dublin, Va., from the closely held Pulaski Furniture Corp., Pulaski, Va. Terms were not disclosed.

HEILIG-MEYERS CO., Richmond, Va., the largest furniture retailer in the United States, said it had hired Lazard, Freres & Co., New York, an investment bank, to help explore alternatives, including a possible sale of the company.
